page.title: 04THE CIVIL WAR AT ORMSKIRK
page.content: During the Civil War, Ormskirk was to witness the only time in it's history when military action affected the area. James, Lord Strange, The Earl of Derby had the power to raise troops and he raised a large force which he deployed on the moor at Ormskirk. General Egerton had a smaller force stationed at Ormskirk and the two sides met on Aughton Moss on August 20th 1635. The Parliamentarians won the day and as result of this a local farm now bears the name Trenchfield Farm. In recent years armour and weapons have been found at the site of the battle with the battle field itself being now used for agriculture.
